thread.title: Down to wire: Lions prevail, 'Stangs downed in regular-season finales
thread.title_full: Down to wire: Lions prevail, 'Stangs downed in regular-season finales

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Down to wire: Lions prevail, 'Stangs downed in regular-season finales
text:
Down to wire: Lions prevail, 'Stangs downed in regular-season finales Waldo County squads playoff-bound, Heal Points finalized Oct. 14 By Staff | Oct 14, 2015 
The Belfast and Mount View high school field hockey teams wrapped their respective regular seasons on Tuesday, Oct. 13 as the Lions and Mustangs participated in one-goal road games that went down to the wire. 
The Lions emerged with a 2-1 win over Erskine Academy of South China in double-overtime, while the Mustangs were downed 4-3 by Maine Central Institute of Pittsfield. 
Belfast and Mount View are playoff-bound, but will not know their quarterfinal opponents until the Maine Principals' Association Heal Points are finalized on Thursday, Oct. 14. 
The following is a recap of both contests: 
Belfast 2, Erskine Academy 1 (2OT) 
At South China Oct. 13, the Lions survived by the skin of their teeth as they emerged victorious over the Eagles in overtime. Erskine Academy led 1-0 at halftime. 
Katelyn Hustus started the scoring for the host Eagles with 21:46 left in the first half, while Kylie Nelson responded two minutes into the second half to tie the game for the Lions. 
Then, in the second overtime, Nelson took a pass from teammate Alicia Gaiero and banged the back of the cage as Belfast wrapped the regular season with a thrilling win. 
Belfast held an 18-5 lead in shots and a 24-6 advantage in penalty corners. Morgan Fernald made four saves in the cage for the Lions, while Hannah Burns made 15 saves in goal for the Eagles. 
The Lion jayvees also earned a 7-0 win over the Eagles. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (11-3, 118.6735 points) is fifth, while Gardiner (12-1, 134.0816 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Maine Central Institute 4, Mount View 3 
At Pittsfield Oct. 13, the Mustangs lost a heartbreaker to the Huskies, who scored the game-winning goal with 31 seconds remaining in regulation. MCI led 1-0 at halftime. 
Leading the Mount View offense were Risa Fox (goal, assist), Michelle Bilodeau (assist), Megan Mikel (goal), Krysta Porter (assist) and Reanna Boulay (goal). 
For MCI, Addi Willians (4 goals), Victoria Friend (assist), Emily McAlpine (assist) and Madisyn Hartley (assist) paced the offense. 
Alexis Bowman made seven saves on 11 shots in the cage for the Mustangs, while Mikayla Carr made four saves on seven shots in goal for the Huskies. Mount View held a 9-3 edge in penalty corners. 
The MCI jayvees also earned a 3-0 win over Mount View. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class C North, Mount View (9-5, 96.8367 points) is third, while MCI (10-4, 112.1939 points) is first in the 11-team region. The top eight teams qualify for the playoffs.
